Title: N/A

reviewText: I too am a little annoyed that Warner Bros is repeating cartoons from the Golden Collections but this collection needs to be judged on its own merits. All of these cartoons are top-shelf Tweety and Sylvester with no filler, unlike the truly horrible Roadrunner and Coyote disc or the lackluster Bugs, Daffy and Foghorn Leghorn releases.  Those discs had many new-to-DVD toons but the majority of them were lame late-50s and 60s releases.These Tweety & Sylvester shorts are truly the best of the best and need to be rated independently of the Golden Collections which many people could not afford.  From what I understand Warners Restoration Dept. spent so much money on restoration for the Golden Collections  that they need to release some repackagings to make their money back. Anyone who doesn't already have the Golden Collections should be very happy with this disc.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have the majority of the shorts on other Looney Tunes releases, but I made the mistake of buying this DVD thinking that there would be a few never-before-released to DVD. Don't get me wrong, the 15 shorts are great to watch, but I already own them. If you don't own any of the Golden or Spotlight Collection, then this is a great way to start your collection, but if you already own the others then you don't need to buy this DVD.The shorts are:Tweetie PieBad Ol' Putty TatAll A Bir-r-r-dCanary RowPutty Tat TroubleRoom and BirdTweety's S.O.S.Tweet Tweet TweetyGift WrappedAin't She TweetSnow BusinessSatan's Waitin'The Last Hungry CatBirds AnonymousTweety and the Beanstalk
summary: I Only Recommend The DVD for New Collectors

reviewText: Since I already own all 6 Looney Tunes Golden Collections, I already own every cartoon that's on "Looney Tunes Super Stars' Tweety & Sylvester: Feline Fwenzy."But I bought it anyway, because these are wonderful cartoons, and I thought it would be convenient to have an entire DVD with nothing but Tweety and Sylvester cartoons.In fact, if they ever release a 2 or 3 DVD set that has all 42 theatrical Tweety and Sylvester cartoons from the "Golden Age," I will buy that too - even though it will mean that I would own some of these cartoons in triplicate.
summary: I think this is a fantastic DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I know many other reviewers are disappointed by the Winter 2010 release of this Looney Tunes Super Stars dvd edition, but at least one should consider this perspective: it is far better than many other classic cartoon compliations.  In this 15-cartoon collection dating back almost seventy years, you will be receiving the following:1. "Tweetie Pie"  2. "Bad Ol' Putty Tat"  3. "All-a-Birrd"  4. "Canary Row"  5. "Putty Tat Trouble"6. "Room and Bird"  7. "Tweety's SOS"  8.  "Tweet Tweet Tweety"  9.  "Gift Wrapped"  10.  "Ain't She Tweet"11.  "Snow Business"  12.  "Satan's Waitin'"  13.  "The Last Hungry Cat"  14.  "Birds Anonymous"  and15. "Tweety & the Beanstalk."P.S.  Other than a "Yogi Bear" movie trailer, there aren't any special features.Yes, several of these wildly hilarious cartoons have been released to DVD or home video before.  Here's the upside, though: this relatively low-priced collection is really meant for those consumers who either didn't want or, more importantly, couldn't afford a set of the "Looney Tunes Golden Collection."  Enjoy these wonderfully timeless cartoons of the hapless tuxedo cat and the not-quite-so-innocent canary with a youngster who has never seen them before, and see what laughs and smiles that Sylvester & Tweety can still evoke.My only suggestion is to find a great sale price first.Rating: 10/10 (appropriate for all ages).
summary: I Tawt I Taw a Puddy Tat: The Classic Cat 'n' Bird Chase

reviewText: This DVD's issue bothers me a LOT more than the fake "widescreen matting" on the Bugs and Daffy LTSS discs. WHV decided to make this DVD a "double dip" of DVD's already on the LTGC sets. Why couldn't they release some NEW stuff to DVD, like THE REBEL WITHOUT CLAWS- you know, that awesome remake of 1944's PLANE DAFFY? Or what about my all-time favorite, THE JET CAGE?Don't get me wrong, though. The cartoons on this compilation are still pretty good, and it's OK to buy ONLY IF you don't have the LTGC sets and your budget is low, and are a serious Tweety/Sylvester fan. Otherwise, stay away.

reviewText: NO NEED TO BUY THIS DVD, you already got these in the Golden Collections.Here is the list of the cartoons that we ALREADY HAVE.  At least these are not going to be masked to look widescreen."Tweetie Pie" (GC Vol 2)"Bad Ol' Putty Tat" (GC Vol 2)"All Abir-r-r-d!" (GC Vol 2)"Canary Row" (GC Vol 1)"Puddy Tat Twouble" (GC Vol 1)"Room and Bird" (GC Vol 2)"Tweety's S.O.S."  (GC Vol 1)"Tweet Tweet Tweety" (GC Vol 2)"Gift Wrapped" (GC Vol 2)"Ain't She Tweet" (GC Vol 2)"Snow Business" (GC Vol 2)"Satan's Waitin'" (GC Vol 6)"The Last Hungry Cat" (GC Vol 3)"Bird Anonymous" (GC Vol 3)"Tweety and the Beanstalk" (GC Vol 5)It seems that Warner Home Video has lied to us about not repeating any Golden Collection Cartoons in this new Looney Tunes Super Stars series.  I also assume Jerry Beck has lost his say on what goes into these DVDs.  Japan got a new set of Tweety DVDs that feature cartoons not issued on DVD in the U.S.  There are still 25 Tweety & Sylvester cartoons not released to DVD in the U.S.This 4th Super Stars DVD release was originally going to be a Porky Pig set until Warner thought it would be mostly B&W; cartoons from the 1930's.  By my count there are 10 Porky Pig color cartoons & 10 Porky Pig & Daffy Duck color cartoons not released yet, so that argument doesn't hold.The official statement from Warner Home Video:"The first two releases of the Looney Tunes Super Stars series were enthusiastically received by consumers and we are thrilled to offer these next two installments from the series," said Amit Desai, WHV Vice President of Family, Animation and Partner Brands Marketing. He added, "This series gives us a chance to showcase some of the most popular Looney Tunes characters in their own collections, and to bring out some wonderful material that we've not had the opportunity to put on DVD before. These collections are must-haves for any Looney Tunes fans and animation lovers."Hmm, even their Vice President of Family, Animation and Partner Brands Marketing (wow what a title to have) doesn't have a clue these are not new.Well there are some false accounts in his statement as I understand this Super Stars DVD series has been discontinued, a few more characters are going to get their own discs along with more double-dip re-issues.The budget for restoration work on the Looney Tunes cartoons has run out, that is why there are re-issues here.
summary: Bad Ol' Puddy Tat! We already have these.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For those of you (like me) who diligently snapped up the Looney Tunes Golden Collections (all 6 of them), you might want to steer clear of this collection, because from what I heard, it has nothing that hasn't been covered by the LTGC releases.Not that it isn't great stuff.  If you DON'T have the LTGC's, then I'd give this DVD 5 stars.  But I do have the LTGC's and the prospect of not getting previously unreleased Sylvester and Tweety shorts is DETHPICABLE!!!What you get here are the 2 S & T shorts that won Oscars (Tweetie Pie and Birds Anonymous) and at least one other (Mouse and Garden) that was nominated for an Oscar.  Notably missing are Hyde and Go Tweet (where Tweety drinks some of the Hyde monster formula and he and Sylvester take turns being the hunter and the hunted), Rebel Without Claws (which takes the S & T formula to a Civil War battlefield), Dog Pounded (which features a Pepe Le Pew cameo), and Hawaiian Aye Aye (which takes S & T to Hawaii where a shark takes the place of the bulldog in guarding Tweety).  I also loved Tom Tom Tomcat which depicts Sylvester and a bunch of other cats as Hollywood-style Indians, but I can see why this one will NEVER be released on an official Warner Bros. DVD.So keep checking You Tube for these and other S & T shorts that won't make it to DVD.
summary: I tawt I taw...all of these before
